DOC.brief_summary: Pain treatment after periacetabular osteotomy is traditionally based on systemic opioids wich have side effects. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the analgetic effect of wound infiltration with local anaesthesia after periacetabular osteotomy.
DOC.brief_title: Postoperative Analgesia With Local Infiltration After Periacetabular Osteotomy
DOC.criteria: Periacetabular osteotomy due to traditional dysplasia or retroverted acetabulum Informed consent Intolerance of local anaesthesia Habitual use of opioids
